meanings.sent1: The children played in the grunge at the construction site.
meanings.sent2: The grunge on the kitchen floor needed to be cleaned.
meanings.sent3: The puppy rolled around in the grunge and got all messy.
meanings.sent4: The grunge on the old book gave it a sense of history.
meanings.sent5: The grunge in the alley was so thick, you could almost touch it.

meanings.definition: A style of rock music characterized by a dirty sound
meanings.sent1: The band's music had a unique grunge that appealed to many fans.
meanings.sent2: The grunge concert was filled with energetic music and passionate fans.
meanings.sent3: The grunge music made the audience want to dance uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: The grunge of the guitar riffs echoed through the venue.
meanings.sent5: The grunge of the drums added a raw intensity to the performance.

meanings.sent1: Please don't grunge up the freshly washed car with your muddy shoes.
meanings.sent2: The kids managed to grunge the living room in just a few minutes.
meanings.sent3: He always finds a way to grunge his clothes right before an important meeting.
meanings.sent4: The rain started to grunge the sidewalks, making them slippery.
meanings.sent5: The artist intentionally grunged the painting to give it a more rugged look.
